Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Medior Data Analyst - Amsterdam | 40 hours




Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox. Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.




We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data-driven decision-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.




Key responsibilities:

Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
Design dashboards that enable informed, data-driven decisions.
Analyze growth to identify high-performing areas and new opportunities.
Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.




You:

2 to 4 years of experience in a data-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
Hands-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
Experience in consulting or retail is an asset, especially in roles focused on addressing business challenges.
Able to communicate complex data insights in a clear, actionable format for non-technical audiences.
You are based in or around Amsterdam




We offer:

A competitive salary plus 8% holiday pay
Hybrid way of working
26 holidays per year (based on full-time employment) and the option to exchange public holidays
Unlimited access to all our high-end fitness locations for you and a +1
Unlimited access to well-being services for you and your family via OpenUp
An inspiring head office, a short 10-minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station
A diverse and energetic team of 500 colleagues pushing boundaries and supporting one another

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Overview

JOB DESCRIPTION

We are seeking a Data Analyst II to join our growing Data organization and help set up our Risk & Governance Analytics team. The role reports into the Financial Analytics Senior Manager and will focus on creating insight to drive the growth of the business, partnering closely with the Accounting, Tax, and Finance functions.

Building product, financial, and marketing reporting will be a top priority for this analyst, as well as providing ongoing analysis and recommendations to stakeholders.

Responsibilities


Develop a strong understanding of Fanatics Betting and Gaming, as well as related products and operations.
Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders in Finance, Tax & Data.
Design and build insightful metric definitions, KPIs, and reporting.
Become a key voice in driving performance in a number of business areas (Product, Acquisition, Marketing, & CRM) across both Sportsbook & Casino.
Collaboration with other Analysts and Data Scientists to find solutions to business problems.
Gather and present insights metrics and activities to key stakeholders, becoming a trusted source of intelligence over time.
Remain current on technology and trends in data analytics and the sports betting & gaming world.
Must be open to occasional travel to Fanatics Betting & Gaming offices and other locations for conferences, events, meetings, and team building activities.


Qualifications


Strong analytical skills, with ability to extract data and transform it into both ad-hoc and structured continuous insights.
Demonstrated ability to partner closely with stakeholders, earning trust and prioritizing relationships.
Experienced with building dashboards and reporting tools (e.g. Tableau, Microstrategy, Power BI, Looker).
Customer obsessed and experience focused; highly outcome-oriented and data-driven; experienced in working in high-growth environments.
Strong skills in SQL and Tableau.
Excellent at influencing and problem solving.
Positive and flexible attitude, a willingness to embrace new initiatives.
Experience or interest in the sports/betting industry are a bonus but not required.
Experience with SOX and internal controls are a plus.


If you possess some of these skills but not all of them, we still encourage you to apply!

The expected salary range for this role is based on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. This role is eligible for the Fanatics Betting and Gaming annual bonus program and an equity award. *Salary range is listed in USD; actual salary will vary based on location. *Salary Range: $88,000 - $144,000 per year (actual salary will be determined in part by a successful candidate’s geographic location). In addition to base salary, bonus, and equity, full-time employees are eligible for Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, paid time off, and other benefits like GymPass, Pet Insurance, Family Care Benefits, and more. We’ll also give you $700 to set up your home office! Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position. This is a remote position; however, candidates must reside in one of the following states: AL, AZ, GA, IA, IN, KY, LA, MI, MN, MO, NE, NH, NC, OH, OK, OR, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VT, VA, WA, WI, WV. Alternatively, we are open to a hybrid role based in Denver, CO.

For information about our benefits, please visit https://benefitsatfanatics.com/

About Us

Fanatics is building a leading global digital sports platform. We ignite the passions of global sports fans and maximize the presence and reach for our hundreds of sports partners globally by offering products and services across Fanatics Commerce, Fanatics Collectibles, and Fanatics Betting & Gaming, allowing sports fans to Buy, Collect, and Bet. Through the Fanatics platform, sports fans can buy licensed fan gear, jerseys, lifestyle and streetwear products, headwear, and hardgoods; collect physical and digital trading cards, sports memorabilia, and other digital assets; and bet as the company builds its Sportsbook and iGaming platform. Fanatics has an established database of over 100 million global sports fans; a global partner network with approximately 900 sports properties, including major national and international professional sports leagues, players associations, teams, colleges, college conferences and retail partners, 2,500 athletes and celebrities, and 200 exclusive athletes; and over 2,000 retail locations, including its Lids retail stores. Our more than 22,000 employees are committed to relentlessly enhancing the fan experience and delighting sports fans globally.

About The Team

Launched in 2021, Fanatics Betting and Gaming is the online and retail sports betting subsidiary of Fanatics, a global digital sports platform. The Fanatics Sportsbook is available to 95% of the addressable online sports bettor market in the U.S. Fanatics Casino is currently available online in Michigan, New Jersey, Pennsylvania and West Virginia. Fanatics Betting and Gaming operates twenty-two retail sports betting locations, including the only sportsbook inside an NFL stadium at Northwest Stadium. Fanatics Betting and Gaming is headquartered in New York with offices in Denver, Leeds and Dublin.

Title: Jr. Analyst, People Data (Animation)
Description:
Netflix Animation Studios is on a mission to entertain the world with bold, immersive animated films that are timeless and impactful. We are paving the way for the future of animation by building a community of amazing artists and talent across three vibrant locations globally. Come join us!

Role Overview

The Jr. Analyst, People Data (Animation) will support Netflix Animation Studios’ global talent team by supporting Global Talent initiatives centered on people analytics and data integrity/quality control for Talent Acquisition, Artist Management, and Talent Development.

Reporting to the Talent Development & Ops Manager, this role will partner with Talent Acquisition and Artist Management to focus on Data Quality Control (QC) and integrated systems, Airtable & Talent systems support, building and maintaining crew databases, talent data workflows, and collaboration.

The ideal candidate has a passion for Animation, an analytical and operational mindset, while partnering with a dynamic/ever-growing team. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are critical, as well as impeccable attention to detail, for effectively managing internal data and optimizing workflows.

Key Responsibilities

Data Quality Control and Integrated Systems


Maintain data accuracy and integrity across interconnected systems and operating tools, focusing on rigorous data quality control (QC) practices for clean and reliable data.


Tools Management and Product Support/Discovery


Act as a junior product manager for Airtable, supporting technical needs, and enhancements to meet team objectives.
Build and maintain the crew database for internal talent movement, housing detailed information on specific skill sets, capabilities, and portfolios to optimize the recasting process and potential placements.
Produce reports on project needs and actualized crew assignments for effective production planning on behalf of Talent.
Support with discovery of new tools to optimize current workflows and tools.


Talent Workflows and Notifications


Design, build, and test solutions to streamline and optimize talent workflows, considering international complexities, multi-system environments, and administrative demands.
Implement and refine notification systems to enhance communication and efficiency within talent operations.


Communication and Cross-Functional Collaboration


Communicate complex data insights effectively through excellent written and verbal skills.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support strategic decisions and data requirements, fostering an environment of growth and adaptability within a dynamic team setting.


Qualifications


Data Management and Analysis:
Experience with data quality control, data management, and ensuring accuracy across multiple systems.
Proficiency in working with complex data sets to solve analytical problems.


Product Management:
Basic experience or exposure to product management principles, particularly in managing and enhancing workflow tools like Airtable.
Experience working with a team in an Agile/SCRUM environment


Industry Knowledge (Preferred):
Passion for and understanding of the Animation or Entertainment industry, particularly within talent acquisition, management, and development contexts.


Communication and Collaboration:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights for a variety of stakeholders.
Experience working collaboratively with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Problem-Solving:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to tackle non-routine analysis issues.
Ability to design and implement process solutions for streamlining workflows.


Tools & Systems:
Airtable
Workday
Production Tracking Tools
Google Sheets
Eightfold
Zendesk
Educational Background: A degree in a relevant field such as Data Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related discipline is preferred but not required.


This role is based in the US.

At NAS, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your compensation. We rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, location, skills, and experience. The overall market range for this role is typically $79k - 133k. This reflects total compensation; we do not have stock options.

NAS benefits can include medical/dental/vision plans, mental health support, retirement programs, and family-forming benefits, paid leave of absence programs, and paid time away programs to be used for vacation and sick paid time off. See more detail about our benefits here.

Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

WHAT YOU’LL DO

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to lead and coordinate analytical initiatives across one of our Digital Value Streams within Commercial Development & Growth. This role involves driving the full analytical lifecycle—from hypothesis development through data analysis to actionable insights and strategic recommendations while ensuring data quality, accessibility, and reliability throughout the process.

In addition to the responsibilities above, your role will include:


Partner with Product Managers and Value Stream Managers to shape product strategies and prioritize initiatives through data-informed insights.
Drive customer-centricity by analyzing behavioral, commercial, and product performance data to enhance the digital experience.
Define and monitor key KPIs and implement event tracking to evaluate product performance and ensure alignment with intended outcomes.
Lead the development of business cases by integrating commercial, digital, and user behavior insights.
Promote a data-driven culture by enhancing data visibility, educating stakeholders, and translating complex data into actionable narratives.
Leverage SQL and tools such as BigQuery, Looker, and Power BI to explore, visualize, and communicate insights.
Actively contribute to the analytics community within CD&G and across the H&M Group.



Who You’ll Work With

You’ll join a global, cross-functional team committed to delivering exceptional digital experiences through close collaboration, user-centric design, and continuous iteration. The team brings together diverse expertise across Product Design, Analytics, and Engineering, and partners closely with other product teams within the global digital experience organization, as well as key business stakeholders.

Who You Are

We are looking for people with…


Experience in product or business analysis, customer or commercial analytics, management consulting.
Strong experience with SQL, proficiency in Python is a plus.
Previous experience with cloud analytics environments such as Databricks or GCP.
Previous experience within ecommerce, retail, fashion or tech product driven companies.
Academic degree within Business Administration, Economics, Engineering (or similar).
Experience in working with data visualization tools e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Google Data Studio, Looker Studio, etc.
Demonstrated ability to synthesize large amounts of data into clear insights.
Ability to work with multiple stakeholders across different competences (Commercial Leads, eCommerce Managers, Product Managers, Developers, Designers, Data Engineers, etc.).
Experience working within a large matrix organization.
Strong communication skills and an ability to communicate and explain data and its implications to various stakeholders .
Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills.
Fluency in written and spoken English.



And people who have…


Experience working in agile, iterative product development environments.
A proactive, ownership-driven attitude with the ability to manage ambiguity and adapt quickly to change.
Curiosity and a continuous improvement mindset—always looking for ways to enhance the product and the team’s ways of working.



Who We Are

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.

We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE 

We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.

In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries. 

JOIN US

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.

Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.


We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
YOUR MISSION AT VOI

Role

As a Data Analyst at Voi your primary responsibility will be to facilitate informed decision-making by providing actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis. Your contributions will play a pivotal role in our ongoing success in the 12 countries we operate in. By joining Voi, you’re joining a truly data driven company where the data team is at the forefront:


Build decision support tools using data, metrics and dashboards
Guide operational decisions and help product teams build the best products
Solve business and product problems through data analysis
Present your insights and recommendations to stakeholders
Extract, manipulate and visualize data to find and understand patterns
Clean data to develop features and signals in a vast, unordered data set
Help the organization learn from data by advising on performance indicators, tests and analytical methodologies
Teach team members and lead the way for data driven ways of working


What You’ll Need To Embark

Being part of our team means to challenge the status quo and to drive change where you see needed, both in terms of how we work internally and how our operations execute. We believe you have an ability and willingness to learn and adapt to a changing environment, it also means to be a great team player and help us build a fantastic place to work! In addition to being fluent in English we believe the right person has:


Business interest, curiosity and creativity for efficient problem-solving
Experience in translating challenging and open-ended stakeholder needs into valuable analytical solutions
A few years of experience working as a Data Analyst in a autonomous and agile environment
Strong SQL skills
The ability to communicate your insights and findings in a captivating way
Great communication skills, both for collaborating and for sharing insights
Experience working with dbt and python is a plus
A university degree in a relevant field (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Science, Engineering, Business)


WHY VOI?

Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voyage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To


Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
Join the micromobility revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.

Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Universum is a global leader in employer branding insights and research. For over 35 years, we have been helping the world’s top employers understand, attract, and retain talent.







Job Description:




We are looking for an Insights Analyst with strong technical skills in data analysis, visualization, and BI tools. In this role, you will work at the intersection of data, technology, and research — with key responsibilities across three core areas:




1️⃣ Deep data analysis of survey results and large datasets

2️⃣ Development of Tableau dashboards and data visualizations for clients

3️⃣ Coordination of research projects from data collection through to client delivery




As part of the Insights Management team, you will play a critical role in ensuring that data is accurate, well-structured, and translated into insights that drive real value for our clients. The ideal candidate combines technical proficiency (Tableau, SQL, BI tools) with strong project coordination and a passion for delivering high-quality insights.







Key Responsibilities:

Conduct deep analysis of quantitative survey data to uncover key trends and insights
Design, build, and maintain Tableau dashboards and other BI visualizations for internal and external audiences
Coordinate research project workflows from initial data collection through to final client delivery
Collaborate with internal teams (research, programming, data, client service) and external stakeholders to ensure data quality and project success
Prepare, clean, and structure data for analysis and visualization
Optimize and automate reporting processes where possible
Support innovation in data analysis, visualization techniques, and research methodologies
Develop clear, client-ready visual outputs that communicate complex data simply and effectively
Stay current with trends in BI, data visualization, and employer branding







Requirements

Proven experience in data analysis and visualization — ideally in market research, insights, or a related field
Advanced proficiency in Tableau — must be able to develop dashboards from scratch
Strong SQL skills — able to query, manipulate, and structure data
Experience with additional BI tools (Power BI, Looker Studio) is a plus
Proficiency in Excel; knowledge of SPSS, R, or Python is an advantage
Familiarity with survey data and market research methodologies
Strong organizational skills — able to manage multiple projects and deadlines
Experience coordinating research projects and working with diverse stakeholders
Excellent attention to detail and commitment to data quality
Ability to synthesize complex data into clear, actionable insights
Strong communication and collaboration skills
Proactive mindset with an interest in continuous learning and innovation







Qualifications

3+ years of hands-on experience in a data or business analyst role with a strong focus on Tableau dashboard development.
Strong understanding of data visualization principles and experience working with survey and research data.
Proven expertise with Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server or Tableau Cloud – including advanced dashboard creation and performance tuning.
Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms, such as Snowflake.
Knowledge in SQL – able to write queries to extract, manipulate, and validate large datasets.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to balance technical and non-technical stakeholder needs.
Knowledge of employer branding, HR analytics, or market research is a plus.







What We Offer

Be part of an international, collaborative team of research professionals
Flexible, supportive work environment with opportunities for growth
Hybrid work arrangements
30 days of paid vacation + 1 paid wellness day every 6 months
Competitive pension solution
Health allowance




The selection process is ongoing and we are therefore looking forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. We encourage people with different backgrounds, identities, and ethnicities to apply.

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
About Making Science




Making Science is an international digital acceleration company with over 1,200 experts across 15 markets, including Spain, Portugal, Mexico, Colombia, France, Italy, the UK, Ireland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland, Germany, Georgia, and the USA. As a proud consulting partner of Local Planet — the world’s premier network of independent media agencies — we deliver a suite of digital, technology, and performance marketing services to a global clientele. Our expertise spans digital marketing and MarTech, software and cloud solutions, artificial intelligence, and SaaS, all underscored by a relentless pursuit of innovation.




Making Science was ranked 15th in the FT1000: Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies 2023. Committed to making a positive impact, Making Science actively engages in various ESG initiatives. We’ve joined forces with the Climate Pledge, the United Nations Global Compact, and Pledge1%, dedicating resources and efforts to support non-profit organizations. Through these endeavors, we are committed to driving meaningful change for a brighter, more sustainable future.




As part of its commitment to innovation, Making Science offers its clients end-to-end capabilities required for consulting, development, integration, and maintenance of advanced IT solutions. Our global network of delivery hubs not only fosters job growth but also serves as an incubator for cultivating top-tier tech talent, fueling projects that accelerate transformation and modernisation.




Our team is composed of digital native professionals, who have a wide knowledge in the different stages and disciplines of the digital transformation: Digital Strategy, Infrastructures, Software Development, Creativity and UX/UI Design, Digital Marketing, and Big Data.




Making Science is People Centric, and we actively bet on our employees! We believe that they are the key to any successful business, and therefore, our greatest asset. We strive to provide daily learning opportunities for those who work with us and their colleagues. It is also really important that they enjoy what they do, and have positive experiences. We want our employees to feel proud of their accomplishments, and that they belong to a company that is in constant growth, because each person’s contribution is essential to achieve our success. Do you want to be part of this great family?




📝Some details about your department




At Data we are a young, energetic, and fun team! We believe that shared knowledge, teamwork, and internal training are the basis of a versatile, integrated, and powerful team. We value a thirst for knowledge, curiosity, and self-learning capabilities, because they help us stay up to date in an industry as dynamic as digital marketing. We are committed to the promotion of team building events, both inside and outside of the company, that will help us get to know each other better. So, if you think you fit in, don't hesitate and apply to our offer!

🎯 What we’d like you to do




Advance knowledge of Google suite (Including Google Analytics, GA4, GTM and DataStudio)

Follow-up on clients

Analyze and optimize web pages and apps in order to achieve set goals.

Identify digital assets and web page structures that guarantee the best measurements.

Create personalized dashboards and reports based on the client’s objectives (Using Power BI, DataStudio, Qlikview or Tableau)

Develop measurement strategies that tie business objectives to digital measurement solutions and optimize the conversion funnel.

Implementation of the measurement strategies for web and app.

Configuration of campaign pixels and web measurement in GTM

Configuration of measurement strategies in App applications. And configuration of campaign tracking for App (deep linking)

Create A/B and multivariate tests to improve a web’s conversion rate on different devices.

Configuration of measurement strategies in App applications. And configuration of campaign tracking for App (deep linking)




🔊 What we’d like you to bring




We are looking for someone who’s proactive and eager to learn, and has the capacity to adapt to new challenges with a positive attitude.

You have preavious experience in Data & CRO experience.

Advance knowledge of Google suite (Including Google Analytics, GA4, GTM and DataStudio)

You have an advanced level of English, both spoken and written.

You have knowledge of JavaScript and/or web layouts.

You have knowledge of SQL and BigQuery.

English C1 / C2

Minimum of 4 years of experience




✔️Perks of joining us




We give you complete stability with an indefinite job contract.

We offer a fixed salary according to your worth and experience, plus a performance based bonus.

Get the most out of your salary with our Flexible Payment Plan (Restaurant Ticket, Transportation Ticket, Day Care Ticket, and Medical Insurance).

Do you know someone that fits in Making Science? Refer him or her, and you can get a bonus if they’re hired!

Feedback is part of our day to day lives. We recognize a job well done through a continuous feedback model.

The opportunity to meet our international team with our Ambassadors Program.

We care about a healthy work-life balance. You can count on having flexible working hours and one day a week where you can work from home.

You will never stop learning with us: subsidized training, free language classes, learning capsules, an e-learning platform, and many more.

Pack your bags! You’ll have 23 vacation days, plus 24th, 31st of December and San Publicito are off, and we have afternoons off on the eve of national holidays.

Work comfortably and follow your own style, because we don’t have a dress code.

We know how to have a good time!

Never go hungry with our free daily fruit and our vending machine card!

Take a break on our terrace, play foosball, darts, or PlayStation

Be a part of a young, adventurous, and professional team, with people you’ll grow fond of!

Title: Internship - Data Analyst/Engineer
Description:
Mylan AB

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.

We do so via:

Access – Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;

Leadership – Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and

Partnership – Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.

Our global portfolio includes best-in-class, iconic brand-name products as well as global key brands; generics, including branded and complex generics; and other offerings across a wide range of therapeutic areas. We are committed to helping create healthier communities worldwide through education, outreach and better access to treatment.

For those driven to live their lives with purpose, Viatris helps employees realise their full potential by creating a collaborative culture that fosters courage and resilience. Viatris is more than just a place to work. This is a place to make a difference in the world.

The Role & What You Will Be Doing

We are currently looking for a motivated student to join our team for a part-time internship focused on data analysis and data infrastructure. This is a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data engineering within a meaningful business context. You will contribute to the development and maintenance of our internal data infrastructure, an essential tool used to generate insights and support key business processes in areas such as supply chain, finance, and commercial.

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here’s how the Data Analyst Intern (part-time, fixed-term role) role will make an impact:


Maintain and enhance our data infrastructure within Microsoft Fabric to support critical business operations
Develop and maintain clear documentation to ensure the continuity and reliability of our data systems
Leverage the latest technologies in the Microsoft ecosystem to deliver actionable insights and optimize business processes
Collaborate with global technology teams to align and advance local market initiatives
Provide data driven insights to senior stakeholders, including the Country Manager and Directors of Supply Chain and Commercial
Lead and contribute to local data management efforts, ensuring scalable, robust, and future ready data solutions



About Your Skills & Experience

For this role, we’re looking for a candidate who has an effective combination of the following qualifications, skills and experiences:


Is currently pursuing a degree in data science, computer engineering, information systems, or a related field
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure and Fabric ecosystems
Has foundational knowledge of database management, Python and/or SQL
Demonstrates a structured approach to work and strong communication skills
Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English



At Viatris, we are dedicated to building a truly diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t fully align with every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

Internship Details


Part-time (approx. 5–10 hours per week during the academic term), with flexible scheduling based on project needs
Possibility to integrate with a thesis or summer work
Office located in Solna, Stockholm



This is an exciting chance to build valuable skills while gaining insight into the pharmaceutical industry. We welcome applications from students who are eager to make an impact and grow professionally.

Diversity & Inclusion at Viatris

At Viatris, diversity and inclusion are essential to our mission. The diversity we foster in all aspects of our business can be one of our greatest strengths in redefining healthcare not as it is, but as it should be. If you would like to know more about what diversity, equity and inclusion means to us, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/Careers/Diversity-and-Inclusion

Sustainability at Viatris

Corporate social responsibility is fundamental to the Viatris mission. We work to advance responsible and sustainable operations and leverage our collective expertise to empower people to live healthier at every stage of life, recognizing that our actions affect the stakeholders and communities we serve. To learn more about our efforts, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/about-us/corporate-responsibility

At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst till Humana AB




Brinner du för att omvandla data till insikter som gör verklig skillnad? Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens datalösningar för att förbättra processer och beslut i ett bolag som arbetar med något av det viktigaste som finns - människors välmående? Då kan det vara dig vi söker till rollen som Senior Data Analyst på Humana AB i Stockholm.




Vill du vara med och forma framtidens dataarbete på Humana?




Om rollen som Senior Data Analyst

Hos oss får du chansen att bli en nyckelspelare i ett engagerat och framåtblickande team som brinner för att utveckla och förvalta Humanas omfattande datalager och BI-lösningar. I rollen som Data Analyst får du en central roll där du tillsammans med våra controllers skapar smarta rapportpaket och mallar som ger tydlig styrning och uppföljning i våra verksamheter.







Du kommer dagligen att få analysera och tolka komplexa dataset och vara med och vidareutveckla våra datamodeller. Just nu befinner sig Humana i en spännande fas av förändring, där du får stora möjligheter att påverka hur vår framtida dataplattform ska se ut. Vi arbetar idag med Mercur för ekonomisk rapportering och on-prem Power BI för övriga rapporter, men har siktet inställt på en modernare lösning där du blir en viktig del i transformationen.







Välkommen till en arbetsplats där data möter samhällsnytta, och där din kompetens gör skillnad varje dag!







Du får en nyckelroll i att omvandla affärsbehov till smarta datalösningar från kravställning och datamodellering till rapportutveckling i vårt datalager.
Rollen är placerad inom IT men har ett nära och proaktivt samarbete med ekonomiavdelningen där du blir en efterfrågad expert i tekniska frågor kring ekonomisk rapportering, men också ett stöd för andra delar av organisationen.
Tillsammans med ditt team deltar du i spännande och utvecklande projekt som ligger i framkant av datadrivet beslutsstöd.
Vi är ett team som värdesätter nyfikenhet, ständig utveckling och innovation där vi växer både professionellt och personligt.
Rollen erbjuder breda kontaktytor där du samarbetar med kollegor från samtliga länder och affärsområden inom hela Humanakoncernen vilket är en unik möjlighet att bygga ett starkt nätverk och bidra till helheten.







Placeringsort är Humanas Stockholmskontor i Stadshagen och du kommer ingå i ett team bestående av sex drivna och engagerade kollegor.







Din bakgrund

I din nuvarande roll är du van att jobba med datavisualiseringsplattformar och skapande av användarvänliga dashboards. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av Mercur eller liknande verktyg. Vi tror att du i grunden har en utbildning inom dataanalys, ekonomi eller motsvarande och har erfarenhet av modellering av data.







Det är meriterande om du:

Är van att skapa beräkningar och mätvärden, gärna erfarenhet av DAX (Data Analysis Expressions).
Trivs med avancerad datamodellering inför rapport/dashboard-användning
Har erfarenhet av molnbaserade datalager, gärna BigQuery.
Har erfarenhet av SQL (gärna T-SQL), Python, R
Erfarenhet av Mercur eller liknande verktyg.
Är van att bygga dashboards och rapporter.
Har erfarenhet av att analysera realtidsdata.
Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift. Om du dessutom behärskar finska är det meriterande.







Om Humana och vad vi erbjuder

Vi erbjuder en dynamisk roll i en ledande organisation inom vård och omsorg där du får möjlighet att arbeta med datadrivna lösningar och bidra till positiva förändringar. Som Senior Data Analyst har du en nyckelroll på bolaget och din kompetens och erfarenhet är viktig.




Humana erbjuder tjänster inom personlig assistans, individ- och familjeomsorg, äldreomsorg och bostäder med särskild service enligt LSS, Lagen om stöd och service för vissa funktionshindrade. Humana har 20 000 engagerade medarbetare i Sverige, Norge och Finland som utför omsorgstjänster till över 9 000 människor. Vi har en prestigelös arbetsmiljö där vi uppmuntrar varandra till delaktighet och att sprida glädje på jobbet. Här drivs vi av utveckling och arbetar ständigt för att förbättra kvaliteten i vår verksamhet, där du som medarbetare är en viktig del i detta arbete.







Är det dig vi söker eller har du tips på en bra person till rollen?

I denna rekrytering samarbetar Humana med House of Skills. Välkommen in med din ansökan, urval sker löpande så ansök redan idag. Har du tips på en bra person eller om du har frågor om rollen är du välkommen att kontakta Linda Mukka på Linda.mukka@houseofskills.se.







Välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: Financial Data Analyst
Description:
💼 Financial/Risk Data Analyst – BSM Expert | Stockholm (Hybrid)

Be the first in Sweden. Help shape the future. Bring your balance sheet wizardry.




We’re on the hunt for a seasoned financial services professional with solid hands-on experience in FIS Balance Sheet Manager (aka FIS Ambit Focus). This is your chance to step into a highly autonomous role in Stockholm and become the local face of a growing international financial tech consultancy that - despite the sector - doesn’t do stiff suits, rigid hierarchies, or soul-sapping meetings.




This isn’t a fix-it firefighting job. We’re already operating well. But we know with the right person on the ground, we could be doing even more - and smarter. You’ll join a team that’s killing it across the Nordics, and you’ll be the first dedicated hire in Sweden. No pressure. But also, lots of opportunity.







🧠 What you’ll be doing:

You'll partner with banking clients to deliver and support BSM solutions - think implementation, technical setups, data pipelines, upgrades, and modelling. You’ll be part business brain, part tech whiz, and (hopefully) part data ninja.




Work on-site with clients and remotely with internal teams.
Tackle ALM and Liquidity modelling like a pro.
Dive into installations, configurations, ETL processes, and module rollouts.
Bonus points if you’ve touched other modules (IFRS9, FTP, Market Risk, etc.).
Contribute to pre-sales discussions and solution discovery.
Play a key role in shaping how we grow in Sweden.




This is a “wear-many-hats” kind of role where you’ll get to influence how things are done - not just do what you’re told.




🧩 We’d love to hear from you if:

You’ve got 3+ Years of hands-on experience with BSM, especially in ALM and Liquidity.
You know your way around SQL and ETL like it’s second nature.
You’ve worked on installations, upgrades, and know how to troubleshoot when things get weird.
You understand a bank’s balance sheet like a chef knows their knives.
You’re a self-starter, but not a lone wolf - you can build trust with clients and work solo or in teams.
You’re fluent in both Swedish and English.
You’re based in (or ready to move to) Stockholm.




You don’t have to tick every box. Maybe you lean more technical, or more on the modelling and reporting side - we’d still love to chat.




🎯 Why this role is special:

You’re first. Be the pioneer in Sweden. Shape the local culture. Influence who gets hired next.
No red tape. Flat hierarchy. Here, titles don’t create distance. Whether you're a newbie or a vet, everyone's voice gets heard - even by the CEO
Community vibes. Over 200 professionals strong, but with a start-up soul. Slack channels for esports, discord community for after work hours, social events in the headquarters.
Growth trajectory. We’ve grown 15-30% year on year. All organic. Zero debt. We’re here for the long haul.
Employee-owned. After 3 years, you can become a shareholder. Yup, we put our money where our culture is.
Flex life. Hybrid working, strong trust culture, low politics. You do your best work, your way.




🌍 A bit about us (anonymously, for now):

We’re a Nordic powerhouse in the world of balance sheet management and risk analytics. While our home base is in Finland, we’ve already got boots on the ground in Sweden - and now we’re ready to give those boots a full-time owner. Our clients are household names in banking, and we’re proud to be long-term partners, not short-term vendors.




If you’re into finance but allergic to dull, love complex puzzles but not endless bureaucracy, and want to be part of something that’s growing fast but staying human - we’d love to hear from you.




Ready to have a real say in how things grow? Apply now. Let’s talk.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.

We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.

In this role, you'll collaborate closely with Marketing leadership to embed data driven decision making into everything we do. You will lead and hands-on develop our marketing attribution work and guide high impact strategic initiatives that drive revenue.

As our marketing teams increasingly embrace data and experimentation, we're looking for someone who thrives in hypothesis driven environments. Come help us transform marketing analytics at Mentimeter!

What You'll Do


Act as a strategic partner to marketing leadership, curating actionable insights and strategic recommendations to influence direction and guide budget decisions.
Identify and lead high impact marketing analytics initiatives to continuously refine how we collect and model data to report and forecast marketing performance across the marketing funnel - from content engagement and campaign effectiveness to marketing revenue attribution.
Design intuitive, high impact visualizations and dashboards that make data accessible and inspiring.
Champion a culture of experimentation, hypothesis testing, and data informed decision making within a marketing context.
Be an important part of a growing analytics team, defining standards and providing mentorship to junior colleagues.



The context in which you will work

You’ll Be Part Of Our Revenue Analytics Team, Made Up Of Data Analysts And Data Scientists Focused On Catalyzing The Performance Of Our Sales And Marketing Functions. You’ll Report To The Revenue Analytics Manager And Work Closely With


Marketing leadership and marketing teams
Data analysts, data scientists, analytics engineers and data engineers
Revenue operations, martech operations, and finance



We Believe You Have


Roughly 8-12 years of relevant experience
Clear and effective communication skills and the ability to explain complex topics in simple terms.
A strategic, analytical, and empathetic mindset with a committed interest in building data maturity in the marketing department.
Strong personal leadership and a collaborative, humble approach.



And In Terms Of Professional Experience, We Value


Hands-on experience across the full analytics cycle in B2B marketing—from tracking setup and metric design to deriving insights and recommending actions.
Strong understanding of B2B SaaS sales motions, revenue growth and go-to-market strategies.

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
We are Merkle Sweden - part of Merkle Northern Europe. Merkle is a leader in data-driven customer experience management (CXM), and we help the world's best brands deliver unique, personalized customer experiences across channels and devices. We provide expertise in digital analytics, customer experience strategy and consulting, user experience design, CRM, data management, commerce, content management systems (CMS), ad tech and martech. We are part of Merkle Worldwide and dentsu – a global agency network covering 145 markets.




Our Swedish Data & Analytics team is now looking for a Data & Analytics Consultant to join our journey and help us grow.




Merkle is looking for a driven specialist with a huge interest in data and analytics. You’ll be based in either Gothenburg or Stockholm. You may also work from a distance.

Implement metrics for clients and provide regular analysis.
Give recommendations for measurement solutions for digital services based on clients’ business and activity goals.
Maintain and develop a strong know-how of Google Marketing Platform in general and Google Analytics 360 in particular. Other measurement tools may be used.
Provide insights and recommendations that improve clients’ activities and business.
Develop data-visualization solutions (in dashboards) that make it possible for clients to follow sales and other important performance indicators in real time.







Qualifications

Experience working with large amounts of data and an understanding of SQL and databases.
In-depth knowledge of working with Google Analytics data, being an advanced user.
An eye for details, logical thinking, and good problem-solving skills.
Good communication skills in Swedish and English, both in speaking and writing.
Used to presenting to both large and small groups of varying degrees of knowledge, internally within the Group and also with clients.
Good self-management skills and a positive attitude toward change.
Ability to manage different work tasks and projects and prioritize accordingly as you will be working with several clients and projects at the same time.
Ability to work with data analysis and provide accurate recommendations based on data.




Knowledge of data-visualization tools, formal statistics training, and experience with Google Cloud (especially BigQuery) are desirable.




Additional information

Our extensive experience and deep proficiency in Google Analytics 360 and Google Optimize mean that our clients rely on us for their most complex, challenging assignments. Our finances are stable (AAA), and we have a collective agreement and attractive benefits. Several years in a row, we have won the DI Gasell Award, won the Mästargasellen Award, and been named a “Superföretag” (Super Company) by Veckans Affärer and Bisnode.







Some of the Perks We Offer:

Friendly, knowledgeable colleagues who like to share their knowledge.
Possibility to work with multinational companies in a number of different industries, meaning you get a wide range of experience and the chance to work with different data sets.
Working for a certified reseller of several Google Marketing Platform products and working closely with Google in Sweden, England, Ireland, and the United States. We are the biggest player in the Nordics when it comes to Google Analytics 360.
Continuous personal development in the form of lab days, groups exchanging experiences, and your own professional development budget.
Working from an office by Skrapan on Södermalm, Stockholm, or by Nordstan in Gothenburg.
The chance to grow both within your area of specialty and within Dentsu, the global network Merkle Outfox/Northern Europe is a part of.







Is your heart racing a little now? If you can see yourself in all this – both the job and being part of Merkle – we would love to hear from you.

Please send us your CV.

There is no application deadline, finding the right candidate is more important to us than a speedy process. We remove the job-ad when filling the position.

Title: BI Specialist
Description:
Verisure are looking for a skilled BI Specialist with expertise in PowerBI to join our team. The purpose of this role is to maintain and enhance our existing reporting systems in PowerBI, while also playing a key role in developing new reports and analytics solutions. You will work within the PowerBI and Snowflake ecosystem to create and implement new solutions in our designated applications. 

Job Description 

We are looking for a skilled and proactive Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining, developing, and optimizing reports, applications, and data flows, ensuring that stakeholders have easy access to actionable insights. You will work closely with various teams to streamline data processes, challenge requirements, and support the creation of a future-proof BI platform. 

Key Responsibilities 




Maintain and generate reports and applications from relevant systems, ensuring they are accurate, timely, and meet the needs of stakeholders. 




Clarify, structure, and challenge requirements from stakeholders to optimize solutions, minimize the number of reports, and promote the use of existing reports. 




Develop, improve, and optimize reports, applications, and data flows to ensure that they remain relevant and efficient. 




Contribute to the creation of a future-proof, maintainable Business Intelligence platform that meets evolving business needs. 




Analyze data from various applications, summarize results, and draw actionable conclusions to support business decisions. 




Train colleagues and end-users on BI tools and applications, ensuring they have the knowledge and skills to leverage data effectively. 




Empower users across the organization to create their own simple reports and analyses through intuitive BI tools. 




Candidate Profile 

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Business Intelligence Specialist who thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background, particularly in Power BI and SQL, with a demonstrated ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights. They should be proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining high-quality standards. As a team player, the candidate will also be comfortable training colleagues and end-users, ensuring that everyone can make the most of the BI tools and applications. 




Experience: 
At least 3 years of hands-on experience working with Power BI, including expertise in data modeling, creating measures, designing reports, and providing user training. 




Technical Skills: 
Strong proficiency in SQL, with a preference for experience in the Snowflake environment. The ideal candidate should be able to write efficient queries and work seamlessly with large data sets. Proficiency in Python is a plus. 




Languages: 
Fluency in both Swedish and English, both written and spoken. The ability to communicate effectively in both languages is crucial for collaborating with teams and stakeholders. 




Project Management: 
Experience managing multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining high standards of quality and meeting deadlines. The candidate should be able to prioritize tasks, work independently, and ensure timely delivery of projects. 





The BI team   

The BI team consists of two senior BI engineers/specialists who work closely together, supported by the country and cluster teams (BI-North). You will have opportunities for collaboration and mutual support within the team to drive success in your role. 

About Us 

Verisure is the leading player in the market for professionally monitored alarms and security solutions, with over 5.7 million customers in 17 countries. We strive to protect what matters most – 24/7, all year round. The position is based at our office in Linköping or Solna. Interviews are held continuously, and the position may be filled before the final application deadline. Are you ready to take on a key role and drive important improvements in a fast-growing organization? Apply now and become a part of our successful team! 

Start date: As agreed upon. For employment in an authorized security company, approval from the County Administrative Board is required.  

We apply a probationary period for the first 6 months of employment. Interviews will be held continuously, and the position may be filled before the final application date. The final application date is 2025-07-31 

Location: Stockholm or Linköping  

If you have any questions about the position, please contact: 

Christoffer Nilsson, Recruiter at christoffer.nilsson@verisure.se

Hiring Manager: Péter Szántó, BI Coordination Manager at peter.szanto@verisure.se

Title: Produktansvarig – Statistik & Analys till Svenskt Näringsliv
Description:
Vill du bidra till att ta fram lönestatistik som används av den privata arbetsmarknaden över hela Sverige? Svenskt Näringsliv söker en Produktansvarig – Statistik & Analys med ansvar för utveckling och förvaltning av rapportmodulen i vårt IT-system för Näringslivets lönestatistik (NLS). Det här är en roll för dig som vill arbeta praktiskt med statistik och bidra till att skapa beslutsunderlag som används i avtalsförhandlingar och av arbetsgivare i hela landet.

Om rollen

Du ansvarar för resultatdelen i Svenskt Näringslivs lönestatistikarbete – det vill säga den rapportmodul som sammanställer, visualiserar och gör statistiken användbar för våra olika målgrupper. Du samarbetar med utvecklare, statistiker, verksamhetsrepresentanter och användare för att säkerställa att rätt rapporter tas fram på ett effektivt sätt. Du kommer också att leda framtagandet av nya rapporter utifrån verksamhetens behov.

Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:


Ansvara för kravställning och utveckling av vår rapportmodul, som baseras på SAS-rapportmodulen
Testa och dokumentera nya funktioner och förbättringar
Säkerställa att krav, testrutiner och testfall är definierade och följs i samarbete med utvecklare
Hantera backlog inom ditt produktområde
Vara stöd till användare – både internt och externt – genom support, information och utbildning
Delta i dagliga stand-ups med utvecklingsteamet


Din bakgrund

Vi söker dig med:


Akademisk utbildning inom systemvetenskap, ekonomi eller liknande
Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom relevant område
Intresse för statistik, analys och rapportering


Meriterande: erfarenhet av UX, SAS-rapportmodul eller PM3

Du är nyfiken, analytisk och självgående – men också en god lagspelare. Du trivs i gränslandet mellan verksamhet, data och IT, och gillar att göra komplex information tillgänglig. Vi ser även att du har god struktur, ett siffersinne och trivs med att ha koll på detaljer. Du är trygg med att tala inför andra och kommunicerar väl med både tekniska och icke-tekniska målgrupper.

Vad vi erbjuder

Hos oss blir du en del av en organisation med ett viktigt uppdrag som handlar om att påverka och förbättra villkoren för företagande i Sverige. Vi arbetar utifrån vår vision om ett växande näringsliv i ett fritt samhälle. Som medarbetare erbjuder vi dig en stimulerande och attraktiv arbetsmiljö, inklusive generöst friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring och förmånliga försäkringar. Vårt kontor ligger centralt på Storgatan 19 i Stockholm. Du blir omgiven av engagerade kollegor som brinner för att förbättra förutsättningarna för företag i Sverige.

Ansökan

I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Svenskt Näringsliv med Ants. Det ska inte vara krångligt att söka jobb hos oss. Har du inget uppdaterat CV redo räcker det gott och väl att du ger oss din LinkedIn-profil och svarar på några korta frågor om din bakgrund. Ansökan tar bara några minuter och kan göras via din telefon.

Återkoppling och intervjuer sker i augusti.

Om Svenskt Näringsliv

Vi vill att dagens och morgondagens företag ska ha de bästa förutsättningarna att starta, driva och utveckla sin verksamhet. Vi tar fram förslag på åtgärder och reformer som gagnar företagsklimatet. Vi sprider kunskap och bildar opinion. Vi företräder företagen i samtal med fackliga organisationer och myndigheter och ger det svenska näringslivet en röst i EU.

Vår vision är ett växande näringsliv i ett fritt samhälle. Med det menar vi att dagens och morgondagens företag ska ha de bästa förutsättningarna att starta, driva och utveckla sin verksamhet. Sverige ska ha högre tillväxt än andra länder och det svenska näringslivet ska växa snabbare än globala konkurrenter.

Vi företräder 60 000 små, medelstora och stora företag. Dessa är organiserade i 49 bransch- och arbetsgivarförbund. Förbunden utgör föreningen Svenskt Näringslivs medlemmar.

Du ansvarar för resultatdelen i Svenskt Näringslivs lönestatistikarbete – det vill säga den rapportmodul som sammanställer, visualiserar och gör statistiken användbar för våra olika målgrupper. Du samarbetar med utvecklare, statistiker, verksamhetsrepresentanter och användare för att säkerställa att rätt rapporter tas fram på ett effektivt sätt. Du kommer också att leda framtagandet av nya rapporter utifrån verksamhetens behov.

Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:

  • Ansvara för kravställning och utveckling av vår rapportmodul, som baseras på SAS-rapportmodulen
  • Testa och dokumentera nya funktioner och förbättringar
  • Säkerställa att krav, testrutiner och testfall är definierade och följs i samarbete med utvecklare
  • Hantera backlog inom ditt produktområde
  • Vara stöd till användare – både internt och externt – genom support, information och utbildning
  • Delta i dagliga stand-ups med utvecklingsteamet

Din bakgrund

Vi söker dig med:

  • Akademisk utbildning inom systemvetenskap, ekonomi eller liknande
  • Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom relevant område
  • Intresse för statistik, analys och rapportering

Meriterande: erfarenhet av UX, SAS-rapportmodul eller PM3

Du är nyfiken, analytisk och självgående – men också en god lagspelare. Du trivs i gränslandet mellan verksamhet, data och IT, och gillar att göra komplex information tillgänglig. Vi ser även att du har god struktur, ett siffersinne och trivs med att ha koll på detaljer. Du är trygg med att tala inför andra och kommunicerar väl med både tekniska och icke-tekniska målgrupper.

Vad vi erbjuder

Hos oss blir du en del av en organisation med ett viktigt uppdrag som handlar om att påverka och förbättra villkoren för företagande i Sverige. Vi arbetar utifrån vår vision om ett växande näringsliv i ett fritt samhälle. Som medarbetare erbjuder vi dig en stimulerande och attraktiv arbetsmiljö, inklusive generöst friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring och förmånliga försäkringar. Vårt kontor ligger centralt på Storgatan 19 i Stockholm. Du blir omgiven av engagerade kollegor som brinner för att förbättra förutsättningarna för företag i Sverige.

Ansökan

I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Svenskt Näringsliv med Ants. Det ska inte vara krångligt att söka jobb hos oss. Har du inget uppdaterat CV redo räcker det gott och väl att du ger oss din LinkedIn-profil och svarar på några korta frågor om din bakgrund. Ansökan tar bara några minuter och kan göras via din telefon.

Återkoppling och intervjuer sker i augusti.

Om Svenskt Näringsliv

Vi vill att dagens och morgondagens företag ska ha de bästa förutsättningarna att starta, driva och utveckla sin verksamhet. Vi tar fram förslag på åtgärder och reformer som gagnar företagsklimatet. Vi sprider kunskap och bildar opinion. Vi företräder företagen i samtal med fackliga organisationer och myndigheter och ger det svenska näringslivet en röst i EU.

Vår vision är ett växande näringsliv i ett fritt samhälle. Med det menar vi att dagens och morgondagens företag ska ha de bästa förutsättningarna att starta, driva och utveckla sin verksamhet. Sverige ska ha högre tillväxt än andra länder och det svenska näringslivet ska växa snabbare än globala konkurrenter.

Vi företräder 60 000 små, medelstora och stora företag. Dessa är organiserade i 49 bransch- och arbetsgivarförbund. Förbunden utgör föreningen Svenskt Näringslivs medlemmar.

Title: Finance Analytics & BI Lead
Description:
We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!

As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.

The Role: Make Your Mark in a Data-Driven Finance Team

We process millions of parking transactions every month—and this number is only growing. Ensuring our financial data flows seamlessly and accurately across systems (from our parking platform to our ERP and BI tools) is essential. That’s where you come in.

You’ll work at the intersection of Finance and Technology—partnering closely with stakeholders, developing scalable ETL pipelines, and delivering trustworthy financial data models and reports.

🧠 Your Mission


Understand finance requirements and translate them into smart, scalable technical solutions.
Own ETL processes for financial data from systems like Snowflake and NetSuite ERP.
Develop, maintain, and optimize financial reports using tools like QlikSense, Looker, SQL, and dbt.
Ensure data consistency and accuracy across systems
Collaborate with cross-functional data and finance teams to drive automation and transformation initiatives.
Support the implementation of a global ERP system, including data migration and reporting.


🔍 Is This You?

You’re detail-driven and analytical, with the technical expertise and financial fluency to identify data inconsistencies and uncover insights. You’re not afraid to challenge the status quo, automate a clunky process, or dive deep into data to find the story.

Your background


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or BI Specialist working closely with Finance teams.
Strong ETL and data pipeline skills, with a solid grasp of data warehousing concepts.
Advanced SQL and experience with BI/reporting tools such as QlikSense, or Looker.
Understanding of financial reporting requirements and ERP data structures.
A degree in Finance, Mathematics, Engineering or related field (Master’s in Data/Analytics is a plus).
Bonus if you’ve worked with dbt, Planacy or Python.


🧩 The Team: Financial Systems & Data

You’ll Join a Collaborative Team Dedicated To


Streamlining financial processes through data and automation.
Supporting global finance reporting and compliance needs.
Driving adoption of financial tools that enhance insight and efficiency.
Managing data governance, accuracy, and security.


This role is based in Stockholm Sweden.

About Us

Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer




OM DU HAR VILJAN, HAR VI RESTEN

Stadium fortsätter sin AI- och datadrivna resa och söker nu en Data Engineer med starkt intresse för både Data Engineering och Business Intelligence (BI). Vi letar efter dig som vill arbeta med modern teknologi, skapa affärsnytta med data och bidra till att forma Stadiums framtid som en datadriven organisation. Är du vår nästa stjärnspelare?




Vad betyder det att vara en stjärnspelare på Stadium?

Vår mission är att inspirera till ett aktivt liv för alla – och det genomsyrar allt vi gör. På Stadium tror vi på kraften i lagarbete, passion och tydligt syfte. Vi vill att våra medarbetare både ska trivas och utvecklas, och att man hos oss känner att man bidrar till något större.




På vårt kontor i Solna arbetar Data & Analytics-teamet nära affären med att skapa värde genom data. Här jobbar vi med allt från att utveckla AI-modeller till insiktsdriven analys och automatiserade BI-lösningar. Vi har höga ambitioner för hur data ska stötta våra affärsbeslut – oavsett om det handlar om e-handel, logistik, sortiment eller marknadsföring.




Vad innebär rollen som Data Engineer?

Som Data Engineer på Stadium är du en del av vår Data och Analytics-teamet och ser till att rätt data finns på rätt plats – i rätt form. Rollen kombinerar det bästa från två världar – robust Data Engineering och insiktsdriven Business Intelligence.




Du kommer bland annat att designa och utveckla skalbara datapipelines, bygga och underhålla vår datainfrastruktur i Azure (t.ex. Data Factory, Databricks och Synapse), samt ta fram användarvänliga BI-lösningar i Power BI. Som Data Engineer är du också en viktig kugge i att operationalisera våra AI/ML-modeller i produktion och bidra till god datakvalitet och governance.

Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i ett innovativt tekniskt ekosystem och vara med och forma arbetssätt och best practices inom Data Engineering – samtidigt som du har stort inflytande över hur vi bygger en datadriven kultur.




Kvalifikationer

Vem är du?

Vi söker dig som är tekniskt kunnig, affärsintresserad och nyfiken. Du gillar att lösa problem, testa nytt och hitta smarta sätt att skapa värde med data. Du har goda kunskaper i Python och SQL och erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnbaserade dataplattformar - Gärna i Azure-miljö.

Vi ser gärna att du har förståelse för BI och datavisualisering och att du gillar att förvandla data till berättelser och beslutsunderlag. Du har erfarenhet av data-arkitektur och datamodellering.

Som person är du kommunikativ, självgående och en lagspelare som trivs med att samarbeta över teamgränser. Du talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska.




Vad erbjuder vi?

Ett team där datakultur och innovation står i centrum. Vi tror på att demokratisera data och ge våra affärsenheter rätt förutsättningar att fatta insiktsbaserade beslut.

Hos oss får du:

• Vara med på en resa där du påverkar hela bolagets datamognad.

• Arbeta med modern teknologi i ett team med hög teknisk kompetens.

• En arbetsmiljö där prestation, välmående och balans går hand i hand.

• Möjlighet till både teknisk och personlig utveckling.




Varaktighet

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med tillträde efter överenskommelse. Vi tillämpar provanställning.




Ansökan

Som en del i rekryteringsprocessen kommer du att få en inbjudan till din e-mail till att besvara ett personlighetstest och ett logiktest. Det tar ca 30 minuter att besvara testen. Innan anställning genomförs bakgrundskontroll.




Eftersom vi alltid vill vara på tårna och göra saker så enkelt som möjligt är det inte säkert att vi väntar till sista ansökningsdag innan vi går vidare i rekryteringsprocessen. Så vänta inte med din ansökan utan sök redan idag!




Eventuella frågor om tjänsten besvaras via mail av Head of Data & Analytics, Omid Sedighi, omid.sedighi@stadium.com.




Välkommen med din ansökan! Stadium loves tech – Come Join the Movement!




Om företaget




Tycker du också att livet är roligare när det rör på sig?

Hos oss på Stadium jobbar lagspelare som brinner för försäljning, sport och sportmode. Energi, mod och laganda är några av de grundstenar som gjort att det lilla familjeföretaget från Norrköping blivit en av Nordens största sportkedjor. Men vi stannar inte där. Genom innovation och enkelhet fortsätter vi att utvecklas med nya koncept, fler produkter och varumärken på marknaden. Tävlingsandan och passionen genomsyrar allt vi gör och vår mission är att inspirera och ge fler människor möjlighet till ett aktivt liv.




Lyssna för att på 15 min få en inblick i hur det är att jobba på Stadium som företag och hur det är att jobb i butik!




Följ oss på instagram: @workatstadium

Läs mer på vår karriärssida !

Join the movement!




Kontaktperson

Omid Sedighi

Omid.Sedighi@stadium.com

Title: IT Analyst
Description:
Start: ASAP

Location: Stockholm

Duration: March 2026

We’re looking for an experienced IT Analyst, Data Analyst, or Business Analyst to join our team working with large datasets, data analysis, and IT solution design in the credit risk domain. You’ll act as the crucial bridge between business and IT, translating business needs into actionable solutions and ensuring high data quality and compliance within the software development life cycle (SDLC).

Key responsibilities:


Analyze large and complex datasets to extract meaningful insights supporting business and IT development teams
Act as the interface between business stakeholders and IT teams, translating business requirements into high-level and low-level technical designs
Create, review, and refine requirement specifications and solution designs
Perform advanced data analysis using SQL to validate data against business rules and requirements
Support and validate functional testing, including user testing (UT), system testing (ST), and end-to-end UAT
Ensure solutions meet both business objectives and technical feasibility
Participate in the full IT SDLC process, ensuring traceability from requirements through to testing and deployment
Document processes, support test case creation, and verify results against expected outcomes


Job requirements

Requirements


8-10+ years of total IT experience, with at least 3-4 years working specifically as an Analyst (IT Analyst, Data Analyst, or Business Analyst)
Strong background in banking or financial services
Advanced data analysis experience using SQL
Proven experience working within credit risk
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills; confident in managing stakeholders
Solid understanding of IT SDLC processes and how analysis fits into each phase
Comfortable working with large datasets and translating data into actionable insights


Nice-to-have:


Experience with SAS or Python for advanced data analysis
Ability to independently convert business requirements into high-level and low-level solution designs
Experience creating and executing functional test cases
Ability to support testing phases, including UT, ST, and end-to-end UAT


Application procedure

A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.

About The Company

If you are a good match, we would like to receive a CV in WORD format with motivation why you fit this assignment, your availability and any scheduled holidays.

Why Maandag Nordic? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.

For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

Violet AI utvecklar skräddarsydda AI-lösningar, med starkt fokus på regelverksefterlevnad och strategisk rådgivning. Vi brinner för att driva AI-utveckling och påskynda den digitala omställningen hos nordiska företag, eftersom vi vet att AI kommer att påverka samhället minst lika mycket som internet gjorde. Med en imponerande rad framgångsrika projekt och nöjda kunder fortsätter vi stärka våra uppdragsgivares konkurrenskraft och forma framtidens innovation. Vill du vara med och förändra spelplanen? Då är Violet AI arbetsplatsen för dig!

Vi söker dig som är lösningsorienterad och brinner för data. Från inhämtning och transformation till analys och modellträning. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att säkerställa att våra system har en pålitlig och skalbar datainfrastruktur.

Vem är du?

Du har flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta med data engineering eller liknande roller, och har varit med och byggt produktionsklara system. Du gillar att ta ansvar, driva initiativ och förbättra både system och arbetssätt.

Vi Tror Att Du Har Erfarenhet Av

Att arbeta med ETL/ELT-flöden


Datamodellering och datainfrastruktur i molnmiljöer
Python och dataanalysbibliotek såsom pandas, polars, pyarrow m.fl
Kunskap om datakvalitet, testning av pipelines och övervakning
SQL (PostgreSQL eller liknande)
God förståelse för datasäkerhet och compliance-aspekter
Versionering av dataflöden och CI/CD
Att transformera notebooks till produktionsflöden
Att skriva kod som är lätt att underhålla över tid


Meriterande


ML-Ops – särskilt integration av pipelines med ML-modeller
Kubernetes
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med batch- och/eller stream-baserade pipelines (t.ex. Airflow, Dagster, Firehose, Kafka, etc.)
Stora språkmodeller (LLM)
BI/Visualisering (t.ex. Metabase, Looker, Power BI)
DevOps-erfarenhet
Erfarenhet av att jobba med molnplattformar såsom AWS och Azure
Erfarenhet av att sätta upp dataplattformar från grunden
Erfarenhet av on-prem-sjösättning av llm-inferensmodeller

"Jag behöver en retrain!"
