Title: Business Analyst, Performance Analytics
Description:
Are you an analyst with passion for data, analytics an eye for visualization and communication? Do you believe that with the right data you can change people and companies? Join us on our journey to promote situational awareness by empowering our sales and service teams with actionable and decisive insights.

About The Position

We are strengthening our analysis team with a Business Analyst within Performance Analytics, to develop and enable data driven and customer centric strategic decisions through end-user friendly reports. To do this you will work closely with stakeholders to develop powerful KPI:s and steering components utilizing modern databases and analytics.

As Performance Analyst in Consumer Solutions you will always have your end-users in mind, making data and insights truly useful by combining analytics, communication and visualization skills. You are not afraid to apply novel techniques or methods where it needs and your curiosity drives you constantly forward.

With a high degree of autonomy, you are confident in your capabilities in stakeholder management and collaboration to identify new areas for support and improvement across a Nordic organisation. Ideal candidates have a few years of relevant experience, excel in a landscape between data engineers and business and with an analytical mindset and experience of working with Microsoft PowerBi and SQL.

The role will be part of a Nordic team of three people, and reports to Performance Analytics Manager. The sub-team is part or the Performance Analytics and Insights team of nine people. The position can be based at one of our Nordic Campuses in Norway, Sweden or Finland.

Responsibility areas

As Business Analyst, Performance Analytics you will collaborate with any part of the Nordic Customers organization, including sales & service, payment & invoicing among many others to understands their business needs. You will To constantly improve our quality and availability of data, you will be the link between Nordic Customers Teams and the internal data team, supporting the development and maintenance of data pipelines with input on logic, harmonization, definitions and new data needs.

You are tasked with both shorter and longer project in addition to ad-hoc tasks. You will strive for automating tasks when its possible. You will work both with developing KPI:s and data models on request but as well proactively. Your great autonomy and flexibility in creating the solution enables you to use tools you best believes supports the need, even if it’s more advanced such as machine learning.

As the bridge between data engineers and business you will keep the end-users informed and educated of new models, KPI:s and reports. In addition, work closely with the rest of the analysts to ensure we are building best overall solution and share our best practices across areas. You will be responsible together with other analysts of the PowerBI app, maintaining access rights, automation and documentation.

We offer you



A positive, international working environment where we aim high, built on expertise, ambition, and the urge to succeed.
A hybrid work model and a holistic view on wellbeing, reflecting our commitment to supporting you, with care.
A culture built on collaboration and shared success, because we win together.
The opportunity to shape how we work with lead management as a strategic enabler for customer success.



Qualifications



Higher relevant education, preferably in technology / economics / statistics, with emphasis on quantitative subjects.
Proven experience in PowerBI including:
Advanced knowledge of DAX and M -languages, and their pros and cons.
Ability to work as a Power BI Service workspace admin and a champion who drives insight-driven culture forward.
Experience with programming languages like SQL, Python, R and visualization tools like PowerBI is an advantage.
Experience in working with a data warehouse or data lake utilizing Azure and Databricks or similar.
Familiarity with machine learning concepts is a plus, but not required.
Good written and verbal ability in English and any of the Nordic languages. Fortum’s working language is English.
Work experience in relevant field, with proven track-record of creating business growth or improved collaboration through visualization of data.



Personal qualifications: To succeed in this position, you need strong analytical skills and a data-driven approach to structured problem-solving. A commercial mindset, high drive, and target orientation are key, as well as being an effective communicator and relationship-builder. Being self-motivated and able to prioritize tasks effectively is crucial, along with attention to detail in your work. You are also curious and innovative with a focus on applying new technologies, automation of tasks and using hypothesis testing in your problem-solving approach.

About Fortum Consumer Solutions

In Fortum Consumer Solutions, our Nordic Customers Business function delivers value to our customers through Smart, Modern, Advisory, Reliable, and Transparent service and sales tailored to their needs. Our scale and international approach enable ongoing investments in employee development, tools, and processes to uphold top-quality, reliable, and efficient standards. This ensures our customers receive world-class solutions and experiences, contributing to profitable and sustainable operations.

In Consumer Solutions we are offering our 2.4 million customers reliable and sustainable energy, making their everyday lives easier with new technology and innovative solutions and services.

Interested?

Submit your application by 19.06 at the latest. We screen candidates on an ongoing basis and we might call for interviews before the application deadline. If you would like to hear more about the position, please contact Benjamin Hendler through e-mail benjamin.hendler@fortum.com.

To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.

We are Fortum

Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

Title: Staff Data Scientist
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?

Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.


Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 420 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


As a Staff Data Scientist, you will drive critical initiatives focused on spam prevention,name election, and experimentation. This role requires a very strong foundation in advanced statistics, machine learning, and engineering, along with a passion for delivering measurable impact at mega scale.Focused on spam prevention, name election, and experimentation. This role requires a very strong foundation in advanced statistics, machine learning, and engineering, along with a passion for delivering measurable impact at mega scale.

The impact you will create:


Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience.
Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals.
Lead efforts to detect and prevent spam, ensuring user safety and platform trust.
Drive the development and optimization of name election algorithms to improve identity accuracy.
Design and run large-scale experiments to improve user experience and feature performance.
Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and analytics teams to implement data-driven solutions.
Translate complex data insights into clear strategies and actions.


What you bring in:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or a related field.
At-least 7 years of experience in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
A track record leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
Excellent programming skills in Python, SQL
Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and a results-oriented mindset
Customer obsession
Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time


It would be great if you also have:


Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
Experience with data from mobile applications
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
Solid understanding of engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers


Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/

Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.

What we offer:


A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget ranges.
Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

Title: Data Engineer - Learning infrastructure
Description:
The Hendrix Feature team is dedicated to developing a robust, Spotify-wide platform for machine learning features. This platform streamlines the productization of ML models by mitigating the incidental complexities involved in creating and maintaining Features, both in their lineage, offline states, and online states.

What You'll Do


Identifies collaboration opportunities that support the teams and those working with the team/Features (other team and leads) and helps people with different perspectives be successful in their work together.
Is a team-level expert in a primary domain or drives solutions to a broad set of problems across multiple domains for the squad
Delivers on large, complex tasks for features as defined and on schedule, managing all dependencies and communication cross-functionally.
Mentor other engineers, developing their skills and setting an example for engineering standards at Spotify.
Consider the inter-squad connections between features and the rest of the machine learning product area, and Spotify wide machine learning ecosystem.


Who You Are


You have 3+ years of hands-on experience implementing production machine learning infrastructure at scale in Python, Java, Scala, or similar languages
You have a general understanding of data processing concepts
You have experience with agile software processes and modular code design following industry standards
You have deep experience with developing data processing systems at scale and optimizing for performance


Where You'll Be


This role is based in Stockholm
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home


Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

This role is ideal for someone who likes to work with data and analytics in a fast-paced environment with many different stakeholders. It involves frequent international collaboration and offers a dynamic work environment with a diverse range of tasks that value a can-do-attitude, effective relationship management, and adaptability. As our Market Insights Analyst you will work with gathering, analyzing and presenting data and insights from the BEV industry and the HDV market more specifically.

Your Responsibilities



Perform various market and competitor analysis regarding price, features and coverage of other similar services and potential partners.
Set up, maintain, analyze and communicate purchase prices of electricity.
Maintain and expand the activation and classification of our charging network. Gather input and data regarding the charging network, both existing and planned. Perform strategic analysis on where to expand and focus our efforts.
Share insights and lead discussions regarding findings of the analyzes made.
Common operational maintenance, set-up and support tasks.



Your Profile



Analytical: Experience from previous analytical roles with proven great results.
Thrives in a learning environment: Demonstrates an interest in both technical and holistic understanding, continuously expanding their knowledge base.
Is supportive and collaborative: Possesses a natural inclination to support and teach others, contributing to a collaborative work environment.
University Degree: A solid educational foundation is essential. Business or engineering background is preferred, but not mandatory.
Language skills: Excellent communication skills in English.



Why Join Us?



Help shape the future of electric commercial vehicle charging across one of Europe’s most critical regions
Play a key role in scaling a high-impact initiative within the TRATON GROUP, home to Scania, MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International
Work in a dynamic role with touch points with many different stakeholders and roles

Title: Data Engineer (Consultant)
Description:
Come work with us

Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.




About us

Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.




What does it mean to be a Data Engineer Consultant at Netlight?

It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar with your experience, and from there it is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like. As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems, and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.




As a Data Engineer Consultant, you will help our clients in projects with roles in Data Engineering. It can be working within Data Engineering, Data Architecture, or project management in terms of working with data or utilizing data to make product decisions to mention a few examples.




Minimum Qualifications

Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
Verbal and written fluency in English
0,5-5 years of work experience within the data engineering field related to IT and software products in agile teams




Application

We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications. We will get in touch within two weeks if we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time - however, please note that during the summer, response times may take longer than usual.

Title: BI & Data Engineer till Team Data & Analytics
Description:
Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens dataplattform i en affärsnära och Microsoft-driven miljö? Carnegie söker nu en BI- och Data Engineer till Team Data & Analytics – ett nyckelteam i vår molnresa med Microsoft Fabric. Här får du arbeta med hela dataflödet, från datainhämtning och modellering till visualisering i Power BI – och vara med och skapa lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad för affären!




Om DNB Carnegie

DNB Carnegie är Nordens främsta finansiella rådgivare och kapitalförvaltare. Vi sammanför investerare med entreprenörer och företag för att skapa hållbar tillväxt för kunder, ägare och samhället i stort. Carnegie är marknadsledande inom alla sina verksamhetsområden. Läs mer på: www.carnegie.se.




Vilka är Carnegie Tech?

Vi arbetar agilt och levererar moderna IT-lösningar och professionella tjänster för företagets kärnverksamhet, vilket involverar hela kedjan från idé till färdig produkt. Carnegie Tech genomsyras av en öppen, kreativ och affärsdriven arbetsmiljö och här arbetar ca 70 personer. Vårt kontor är beläget mitt i centrala Stockholm på Regeringsgatan 56.




Om rollen och teamet

Som BI- och Data Engineer hos oss blir du en del av Team Data & Analytics – ett affärsnära och tekniktungt team som ansvarar för att bygga och förvalta DNB Carnegies koncerngemensamma dataplattform. Teamet arbetar med hela kedjan från datainhämtning och transformation till visualisering och self-service BI, och spelar en nyckelroll i att möjliggöra insiktsdrivna beslut i hela organisationen.




Team Data & Analytics består av erfarna utvecklare och dataingenjörer som har djup kompetens inom Microsofts BI-stack. Teamet är just nu mitt i en modernisering där ett nytt molnbaserat ekosystem byggs upp med Microsoft Fabric som nav – parallellt med att det befintliga datalagret i SQL Server förvaltas och vidareutvecklas.




Team Data & Analytics arbetar i en Microsoft-nära miljö, med tekniker som SQL Server, T-SQL, Power BI och Fabric – här kommer din kompetens inom Microsofts ekosystem till sin fulla rätt.

I dagsläget är teamets huvudfokus att tillgängliggöra tillförlitlig och korrekt information på ett effektivt och skalbart sätt – för att möjliggöra självständig analys i verksamheten. På sikt är ambitionen att utveckla fler lösningar inom ramen för Analytics, vilket gör rollen strategiskt viktig för DNB Carnegies fortsatta datadrivna resa.




Du arbetar i ett tvärfunktionellt team med kompetenser inom både teknik och affär, där du förväntas ta stort ansvar för att driva utvecklingen av såväl teknik som arbetssätt.




I rollen kommer du att:

Designa och bygga datamodeller och ETL-flöden
Underhålla och vidareutveckla Data Warehouse (SQL Server)
Delta i migreringen till Microsoft Fabric
Bygga och publicera kuber i molnet samt arbeta med modellering i Power BI
Skapa strukturer för Power BI och self-service
Utmana befintliga lösningar och bidra med nya perspektiv
Dela kunskap internt och bidra till teamets tekniska mognad




Vem är du?

Vi söker dig som är en erfaren BI-/Data Engineer med djup kompetens inom Microsofts dataplattform och ett starkt intresse för att arbeta affärsnära. Du brinner för att skapa strukturerad och tillgänglig data, och har ett analytiskt förhållningssätt till både teknik och verksamhetsbehov. Du trivs i en miljö där teknik och affär möts, och du ser värdet i att stötta användare så att de själva kan arbeta datadrivet. Du är nyfiken på nya tekniker, delar gärna med dig av kunskap och tar ansvar för att förbättra både lösningar och arbetssätt – alltid med ett pragmatiskt och lösningsorienterat mindset.




Du har...

Flera års erfarenhet av datalagerutveckling i SQL Server-miljö
Mycket goda kunskaper i T-SQL
Erfarenhet av tabulär datamodellering
Vana att arbeta nära verksamheten och omsätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar
Erfarenhet av Git och versionshantering
Erfarenhet av Powershell
Flytande i svenska och engelska




Meriterande:

Erfarenhet av Spark eller Python
Erfarenhet av CI/CD och pipeline hantering i AzureDevops eller liknande verktyg
Erfarenhet av andra BI-verktyg som TabularEditor och DAXStudio
Tidigare arbete i en regulatorisk miljö, exempelvis inom bank eller finans




Personliga egenskaper




Du är:




Proaktiv, analytisk och affärsdriven
Nyfiken och lärande – delar gärna kunskap
Bekväm i tvärfunktionella team – kan navigera mellan teknik och affär och skapa gemensam förståelse
Samarbetsorienterad, trygg i diskussioner, pragmatisk
Kreativ och initiativtagande




Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?

På Carnegie Tech blir du en del av en innovativ och affärsdriven miljö, där teknik och affär går hand i hand. Vi är inne i en spännande transformation där vi moderniserar vår plattform och bygger framtidens digitala tjänster.




Vi erbjuder också:

Flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete
Friskvårdsbidrag och förmånliga rabatter
Konkurrenskraftig tjänstepension och Föräldrabidrag
Hälso- & Privatvårdsförsäkring med hälsokontroll
Möjlighet till rörlig ersättning
En mängd roliga sociala aktiviteter och föreningar
Carnegie personal development: en mängd olika utbildningar/kurser som erbjuds




För att säkerställa en hög kvalitet och objektivitet i vår rekryteringsprocess, använder vi oss av tester och slutkandidat omfattas av även av en bakgrundskontroll. Denna rekrytering sker med löpande urval, varför vi gärna ser att du skickar din ansökan snarast.

Om du har några frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Ludvig Nilsson, ludnil@carnegie.se, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner.




Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Vi värdesätter mångfald och strävar efter att dra nytta av människors olika erfarenheter, kunskaper och egenskaper. Genom detta kan vi skapa en kreativ och utvecklande arbetsmiljö som ökar möjligheterna att uppnå optimala resultat.

Title: Data Engineer, Stockholm
Description:
Vi söker för kunds räkning. För att ansöka till tjänsten, vänligen besök https://karriarguiden.se/sv/jobb/data-engineer-stockholm. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Vill du vara med och forma framtidens datadrivna beslutsstöd hos Sveriges största rådgivningsbyrå för småföretagare? Vi söker nu en erfaren och nyfiken Data Engineer! Om rollen Som Data Engineer kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i vårt arbete med att tillgängliggöra och strukturera data för analys, rapportering och beslutsstöd. Du arbetar nära controlling, IT och verksamheten – och får vara med och bygga vidare på vår moderna dataplattform i AWS (S3, AWS Glue, Redshift etc), hantera behörigheter via RLS (Row-Level Security) med mera. Rollen är både teknisk och affärsnära, och du blir en viktig kugge i ett team med stora ambitioner. Vem vi söker Vi söker dig som har:


Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med data engineering, dataplattformar eller liknande roller.
God kunskap inom Python, SQL och erfarenhet av molnbaserade lösningar – t.ex. AWS.
Intresse för eller erfarenhet av ekonomi, redovisning eller affärsstöd – du behöver inte vara expert, men förståelse och nyfikenhet på affären är viktigt.
Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och samtidigt bidra till teamet med idéer och initiativ. Det är meriterande om du har arbetat med verktyg som Power BI, Glue eller Redshift – men vi är också öppna för dig som snabbt lär dig nya miljöer och vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss. Varför Ludvig och Co? Vi erbjuder en vardag där du får påverka, bygga nytt och göra skillnad – i ett team som arbetar nära ledning och verksamhet. Här kombinerar vi teknik, affärsförståelse och ett tydligt syfte: att hjälpa Sveriges småföretagare att växa. Hos oss finns också:
Stor flexibilitet i hur du lägger upp ditt arbete och möjlighet att växa tekniskt och professionellt
Friskvårdsbidrag (5000 kr)
Tjänstepension enligt ITP
Utfyllnad av föräldralön
Fina lokaler på Kungsholmen och engagerade kollegor i hela landet
Hybridarbete (två dagar per vecka i Stockholm) Låter det intressant? Då ser vi fram emot din ansökan! Ludvig och Co samarbetar med Friday Vibes i denna rekrytering. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och därför vill vi be dig att skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About The Role:

The role: Data Engineer

Data Engineer Position Profile: Osttra's AI & Analytics team is seeking a highly skilled Data Engineer with 3-5 years of experience to join our growing team in Stockholm, Sweden. You will play a critical role in building and maintaining our data platform in Google Cloud Platform (GCP), which supports a wide range of AI and BI initiatives across the organization. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of data engineering principles and hands-on experience with GCP and Python.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines using GCP services (BigQuery, Cloud Run, Google Cloud Storage, etc.)
Collaborate with AI engineers and data analysts to understand data requirements and deliver high-quality data solutions
Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure data accuracy and reliability
Optimise data processing for efficiency and cost-effectiveness
Contribute to the development of our overall data architecture and strategy
Design and implement infrastructure as code using tools like Terraform


Basic Qualifications:

What We're Looking For:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
3-5 years of experience in data engineering, with a focus on GCP
Experience with IaC and provisioning of infrastructure as code in a cloud environment.
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL
Experience with data modelling, Container platforms, ETL/ELT processes, and data warehousing
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and workflows is a plus
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Proficient in using version control systems (e.g., Git), CI/CD pipelines, and testing frameworks
Demonstrated interest or experience in financial markets


Benefits:


Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI and BI projects
Work with a talented and supportive team
Chance to make a real impact on the financial industry

Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.

OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.

With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.

Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.

Learn more at www.osttra.com.

Benefits:

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.

Our Benefits Include:


Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.

Title: Data Analyst - Retail Data Products
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Analyst – Retail Data Products

Are you good at translating the why and what into how?

Do you enjoy being the one who connects people, process, and technology to get the best results? If yes, you might be the person we’re looking for.

We’re hiring a Data Analyst to join our Data & Analytics product team supporting Pandora's Retail business. In this role, you'll work closely with business stakeholders to define needs and translate them into clear, actionable work for engineers and product teams. You’ll also lead and support projects that enhance our data products and drive better decision-making across the business.

You will be part of our agile product team, collaborating with Data Engineers, Analysts, Product Managers, and business stakeholders to ensure the successful development and adoption of data-driven solutions.

What you’ll do:


Act as the key link between business stakeholders and the data product team – understanding needs, clarifying goals, and translating them into user stories and requirements.
Help define, prioritize, and manage the backlog for data products, ensuring the work aligns with business value and strategic goals.
Lead and support data-related projects end-to-end – from discovery to implementation and rollout.
Participate in agile ceremonies (stand-ups, planning, retrospectives, demos) and contribute to a high-performing team culture.
Analyse, document, and map current business processes and identify opportunities for improvement.
Support the design and rollout of new functionality, including documentation, training, and stakeholder communication.
Manage stakeholder expectations and ensure transparency of progress, blockers, and outcomes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including engineering, architecture, and business operations.



What you bring:


2+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or similar role working closely with both business and technical teams.
Strong ability to define and document business requirements and translate them into functional and technical specs.
Experience in agile delivery, with hands-on participation in backlog management, sprint planning, and user story writing.
Basic understanding of data platforms, data pipelines, and tools like SQL (ability to query data is a plus).
Strong facilitation and communication skills – you can run workshops, align stakeholders, and make complex topics simple.
A structured, self-driven, and collaborative mindset with the ability to manage multiple priorities.
Experience working in a large global organisation, preferably in retail or e-commerce, is a plus.
A passion for enabling data-driven decision-making through well-designed tools and processes.



Why join us?


You’ll play a pivotal role in shaping how Pandora uses data to drive retail excellence.
You'll be part of a collaborative, supportive, and growing product team.
You’ll gain exposure to a wide range of stakeholders and business areas – and your work will directly impact decision-making and performance.
We offer a hybrid, flexible work environment and opportunities for career growth in an international setting.



Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position.If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com .

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Digital & Technology Hub in Copenhagen, rapidly growing environment of highly skilled and experienced colleagues. Which is a key initiative that goes along with Pandora’s experience & ambitions.

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment – that we are not only talking about – but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location

🌍 Remote (CET +/-3h) or 🇩🇰 Copenhagen




The product

Next-generation data warehouses like Snowflake, Databricks, and Google BigQuery are becoming the standard place to centralize all your data since they have become affordable and highly performant.




Built around modern data warehousing, we provide state-of-the-art data infrastructure that works in a few clicks without data engineering. In that way, Weld enables powerful analytics and workflows that can make a company truly data-driven.




⚡ Give the product a try; sign up at weld.app




The role

At Weld, we believe data should empower, not overwhelm, teams. As a Senior Data Analyst, you’ll be critical in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive internal decision-making and customer success. You'll work internally and directly with customers, helping them make sense of their data and unlock its full potential by using the Weld platform.




You’ll support every data lifecycle stage, from designing and modeling warehouse schemas to crafting dashboards and running deep analyses. You’ll also serve as a trusted partner to customers, helping them implement metrics, interpret data trends, and get value from their ETL and reverse ETL processes.




We're hoping that you;

are fluent in SQL and have experience with data modeling tools (like dbt or similar)
have a solid understanding of ETL, reverse ETL, and data warehousing best practices
are comfortable working with large datasets and drawing actionable insights
have a good understanding of statistics and experimental design
have strong communication skills and enjoy working directly with customers to understand their data needs
can clearly communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
have experience mentoring junior analysts or collaborating cross-functionally with product and engineering teams
bonus points for experience using Python or R for data wrangling, automation, or statistical analysis, and with BI platforms like Power BI, Looker, Tableau, or Metabase.




The team

As generalists, we have expertise, are always open to new challenges, and offer assistance when needed. Currently, we seek individuals who are enthusiastic about learning and fearless in taking on end-to-end projects. We are looking for curious individuals who can take on a given problem and solve it. We particularly welcome entrepreneurial minds who thrive in the early stages of a startup.




How we work

We prioritize creating a vibrant, fun, exciting, and challenging culture. Our highly talented and passionate team, who firmly believe in the power of collaboration, makes this possible.




We value ownership and offer significant freedom and responsibility while fostering close teamwork. We are remote-friendly and strive to create the best office and remote experiences. We achieve this through various means, such as organizing social events and gatherings for team camps across the globe.




How to apply

Apply via LinkedIn

Mention 2-3 of your most significant achievements and 2-3 of the most important lessons you've learned in your career.




Some nice things about working at Weld 💛

💰 Competitive salary and equity

🏝️ 6 weeks paid holiday per year

👵 Company-paid pension scheme

🛟 Company-paid health insurance

👩‍🏭 Flexible working hours

✈️ Every quarter, we spend 3 to 4 days together enjoying social activities, team building, and having lots and lots of fun!

💳 Everyone gets a company card from day one. Meaning that you can buy your own things for work whenever needed

🇩🇰 We have a nice office space in central Copenhagen right next to the Opera

🌍 We are remote-friendly, and everyone who joins has the option to work from anywhere CET +/- 3h

🥙 Everyone who joins the Copenhagen office gets free lunch

💻 Macbook Pro

👩‍💻 All the latest and best productivity software and tools

🏡 Company-paid co-working space or home office setup for those working remotely




Our values




Extreme customer focus ❤️

Since we started Weld, putting our customers first has been and will continue to be our top priority. Our ability to make our customers happy will define our long-term success.




Move fast ⚡️

Action beats inaction. Do things now. Not tomorrow. Our intent is not to sacrifice quality but to be efficient by not reinventing the wheel and focusing on the things that matter.




Dream big 🚀

We chase the most ambitious ideas to advance our mission in ways that encourage experimentation, accept failure, and regularly deliver new value for our customers.




Our Mission

Today, being data-driven requires extensive tooling and expertise, which makes it out of reach for most companies. We believe there should be a simpler alternative that enables all businesses to become truly data-driven.




Weld was founded in Copenhagen in 2021 by tech entrepreneurs Jonas Thordal, Jakob Skytte, Jakob Kristensen and Kristian Barrett. All four were early members of the startup success Pleo, where they helped build the data infrastructure from scratch.




That’s when they saw that getting value out of data was a lot easier said than done, so they decided to build a better solution.




We're backed by forward-thinking investors - Cherry Ventures and Frontline Ventures

Our values


Extreme customer focus ❤️

Since we started Weld, putting our customers first has been and will continue to be our top priority. Our ability to make our customers happy will define our long-term success.


Move fast ⚡️

Action beats inaction. Do things now. Not tomorrow. Our intent is not to sacrifice quality but to be efficient by not reinventing the wheel and focusing on the things that matter.


Dream big 🚀

We chase the most ambitious ideas to advance our mission in ways that encourage experimentation, accept failure, and regularly deliver new value for our customers.


Our Mission

Today, being data-driven requires extensive tooling and expertise, which makes it out of reach for most companies. We believe there should be a simpler alternative that enables all businesses to become truly data-driven.


Weld was founded in Copenhagen in 2021 by tech entrepreneurs Jonas Thordal, Jakob Skytte, Jakob Kristensen and Kristian Barrett. All four were early members of the startup success Pleo, where they helped build the data infrastructure from scratch.


That’s when they saw that getting value out of data was a lot easier said than done, so they decided to build a better solution.


We're backed by forward-thinking investors - Cherry Ventures and Frontline Ventures
